greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Pascal's triangle (excluding first, last two elements of each row) read by rows, row n read mod n.
comment: Prime numbered rows contain all zeros.
link: T. D. Noe, Rows n=4..100 of triangle, flattened
mathematica: Table[Mod[Binomial[n, k], n], {n, 4, 18}, {k, 2, n-2}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 06 2017 *)
program: a053202_tabl = zipWith (\k row -> take (k - 3) $ drop 2 row)
xref: Sum of row n = A053205(n). Cf. A053200, A053201, A053203, A007318 (Pascal's triangle).
results.author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu), Dec 12 1999
ext: a(44) corrected by _T. D. Noe_, Feb 08 2008
